intro: Zosterophyllanthos tragulosus, commonly known as the mountain zoster, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the order Zosterophyllales. It is characterized by its small, ribbon-like leaves that are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain streams and rocky crevices. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with a rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread along the substrate. Its reproductive structures are simple, consisting of small sporangia that release spores into the air. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Zosterophyllanthos tragulosus is considered a valuable indicator of pristine, undisturbed ecosystems.
